page.title: 06POPULATION AND EMPLOYMENT.
page.content: Population increase throughout the Colne Valley dates back to the 18th and early 19th century with the advent of the textile industry and improved road, rail and canal transport.In 1860 the population of Scammonden was three times what it is today. The recent decline in textiles has contributed to demographic stagnation. Population trends have fluctuated in recent years.Between 1971 and 1981 the population in the block rose slightly but this increase has tapered off.The percentage of pensioners has risen from 20% to 25% during this period. In 1971,unemployment in the Colne Valley was 2.25%.Now this has risen to 13.7% and the area is considered to be 'Yorkshire's unemployment blackspot'. This factor plus the increasing cost of rural housing has led to population stabilisation in this block.
